```{python}
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import cartopy.crs as ccrs
import cartopy.feature as cfeature

# Location data
locations = {
    "Río Pudeto": (-73.7532, -41.9118),
    "Pumalín": (-72.6483, -42.5195),
    "Isla Quihua": (-73.2483, -41.7464),
}

lons, lats = zip(*locations.values())
labels = list(locations.keys())

# Create a map
fig = plt.figure(figsize=(8, 10))
ax = plt.axes(projection=ccrs.PlateCarree())

# Set extent: focus on relevant region of southern Chile
ax.set_extent([-74.5, -72.0, -43, -41.5], crs=ccrs.PlateCarree())

# Add land, coastlines, and borders
ax.add_feature(cfeature.LAND, facecolor='lightgray')
ax.add_feature(cfeature.COASTLINE)
ax.add_feature(cfeature.BORDERS, linestyle=':')

# Plot sites
ax.scatter(lons, lats, color='red', s=100, edgecolor='k', zorder=5, label='Sampling Site')

# Add labels
for lon, lat, label in zip(lons, lats, labels):
    ax.text(lon + 0.05, lat, label, fontsize=12, weight='bold', transform=ccrs.PlateCarree())

# Add title
plt.title("Sampling Locations of Ostrea chilensis in Southern Chile", fontsize=14)
plt.legend(loc='lower right')
plt.show()
```
